utterances.sentences: And it's now coming to pass. There are thousands more still coming.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, I have been a lawyer in the military most of my adult life.  You use the least amount of force possible to protect you and secure the mission. The mission is to protect the border from being overrun. So, tear gas keeps the people apart. You don't get in a fight. That's a good thing. The bottom line is Donald Trump was right to call the caravan out weeks ago. He is right to make sure it never crosses the border. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('tablet', 'lb21', 'tablet-tw-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } People throughout the world are watching the president. If he blinks here, his credibility on securing the border is dead. He is not going to blink. To my Democratic friends, how go you expect the public to work with us to fix a broken immigration system if you support one wave after another? A lot is at stake here. The president is not going to bend. He's not going to back down. I hope the Republicans and Congress will stand behind him. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb13', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb13', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: So, President Obama tear gases people on a monthly basis. We now have literally and we'll talk to Kirstjen Nielsen, secretary of homeland security, we have identified -- Mexico, too, has identified at least 500, maybe 600 criminals coming across that border that have integrated themselves into the migrant population. And that means -- when I sat through a briefing with Rick Perry in Texas when he was governor, a security briefing that Obama should have been at, when I sat through it, they had a seven-year period of time, 642,000 crimes committed against Texans. Some minor, many serious, including murder. I have interviewed angel moms and dads more than I ever wanted to in my whole life, lost their lives to illegal immigrants that were -- that we even had in our justice system and never deported. At what point does the government bear the responsibility that they didn't do their job and enforce the law? What culpability do they have?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, I think we have a lot of culpability as a nation from ignoring this problem. You know, doing the same old thing and expecting a different outcome is insanity. President Trump is going to stop the caravan. The next ones coming won't come if this one is stopped. He will shut down the border if he has to. Democrats should give him the money he needs to secure the border. If they deny him the funding to secure our border, President Trump is going to push back and fight back. This is a day of reckoning for the American people. What message do you want to send to the rest of the world about our border? If you want to be open borders, this is your chance. If you want to stand firm, this is also your opportunity and I hope Democrats understand you have got to really hate Trump to not see this caravan is a problem for the American people? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb14', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb14', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you a last question about Mueller. The president said he is not going to stop this, never had any plans. He said it numerous times now. At this point, how do we justify as a nation that believes in a constitutional republic, we agree in equal application of our laws, equal justice under the law and Hillary used paid for phony Russians lies to influence the American people. That was used as a fraud on the FISA court, would never verify or corroborated. Hillary never identified as having paid for it. And then it goes further and it is used as part of a leak strategy. The bulk of information according to yours and Charles Grassley's memo used to obtain the FISA warrants. Why has Mueller, if he cares about Russian interference, she paid for it, why is that not an issue?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, you can't blame Mueller. It is not his charter to look at that. I do blame --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Whoa. Why is it not? If he is looking for Russia collusion, why is that not within his mandate when somebody's loan application is within his mandate?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It might be. I blame the Department of Justice for not appointing a special counsel to look at the FISA warrant. They really got away with a lot here. And if I'm chairman of the committee next year, we are going to look at FISA warrant problem. I promise you we will.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You're going to get to the bottom of that. You also -- could we get to the bottom of Hillary's e-mails and destruction of e-mails? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb15', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb15', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: We need a special counsel to look at all of this. Why was the FBI in the tank for Clinton? Did they have a political bias? This screams for a special counsel. That's why Trump was so upset at the Sessions Department of Justice.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Lindsey Graham, Senator, thank you for being with us. When we come back, we'll go live to Mississippi. We're waiting on the results of this crucial last Senate race, and we'll have more on Mueller witch hunt. Don't go anywhere. Joe diGenova, Herman Cain -- they are next, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Joining us now with the latest news on the high stakes Mississippi Senate election, Fox News correspondent, our friend, Peter Doocy, is there on the ground. I'm getting some anecdotal reports about turnout in more Republicans areas versus Democratic areas. What I've heard, and I hope you can confirm, Democratic strongholds didn't maybe have the bounce that would be needed to win in Mississippi. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCY, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: From what I saw a minute ago, it doesn't sound like enough of certain counties are in yet to know for sure.  So, that is the case in some places, maybe not in others. But it was interesting, Sean. This morning, we drove from Gulfport here to Jackson, it's a couple hours. And just about everywhere we went on the side of the road, there were these big flashing billboards that said vote again. And now we do know generally how many people got a message to go and cast a ballot for the second time in three weeks. It was 30 percent to 40 percent of registered voters in Mississippi according to state officials who are saying it started out slow and steady but it really picked up towards the end of the day. Right now, the Democrat, not far from here, the Democrat Mike Espy, is having his election night event at the Mississippi Civil Rights Museum. We understand he is on site watching returns that could make him the first African-American senator elected in Mississippi since Reconstruction. Cindy Hyde-Smith meanwhile trying to make history of herself as the first- ever woman elected to the Senate from Mississippi. And she is waiting to see if voters who said they were offended by a joke that she made about a public hanging voted in larger number than people who took it as a joke.  Her supporters did something at the last minute, too. They tried to shine a light on a Clinton era indictment against Mike Espy and last night some of the people introducing the president and Cindy Hyde- Smith came to the stage to say he had to leave, Espy had to leave as Clinton's agriculture secretary because, they said, he was too corrupt for the Clintons. We'll see which argument was stronger shortly -- Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Peter, listen, please tell me when you talk to your dad and that, please ask him why I was dumped on page 184 of his latest book? I was dumped at the very end, as an afterthought.

utterances.speaker: DOOCY
utterances.sentences: I call him. I text him. I think you are with the entrees. It goes in the order of a meal, Sean. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes, he didn't ask for an entree. He asked me from -- you know, whatever, I wasn't the appetizer. Peter, we'll be checking back with you, monitoring all the results out of Mississippi. We'll bring you any numbers as they come in. They are notoriously slow, unfortunately. We are hoping they come in soon. First, earlier tonight, Jerome Corsi sat down with our own Tucker Carlson.  He was discussing his experience dealing with team Mueller. Let's take a look.

utterances.speaker: JEROME CORSI, CONSERVATIVE AUTHOR
utterances.sentences: Everything they wanted, I had nothing to hide. I gave it to them immediately. And for having forgotten on day one, because I hadn't reviewed the e-mail, this particular e-mail about Ted Malloch, I'm now being charged with willfully and knowingly giving false information, which is nonsense. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.sentences: Do you think that your political views are playing a role in the decision of the special counsel to charge you with a felony?

utterances.speaker: CORSI
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think. And also, by the way, they accused me of deleting the e-mails. And I told them to restore -- they restored the emails I supposedly deleted through the time machine. This is a political witch- hunt.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Here with reaction, former U.S. attorney for the district of Columbia, Joe DiGenova, and America Fighting Back chairman, Herman Cain. Joe, let's go, this is pretty profound. We call it. Test the lie, and what -- what usually happens is, you sit down and they say, listen, if you don't want to spend 10 years, the rest of your life in jail, we need information. So, they make a deal and usually, sadly, often is the case, Joe, tell me if I'm wrong, they are basically telling you what they want to hear. And Paul Manafort and Jerome Corsi, from my observation, are refusing to tell them what they want to hear even though they would benefit probably dramatically and may both face life in prison. But they are refusing to capitulate. Is that accurate? Is that probably accurate?

utterances.speaker: JOE DIGENOVA, FORMER U.S. ATTORNEY, COLUMBIA
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think it is. And I think we can tell right now from the manner in which the Mueller investigation has failed, utterly failed to produce any evidence of collusion between the Russian government and the Trump campaign or President Trump himself. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } And so, now what they are doing is they are in spasms of vindictive prosecution, unethical prosecution just to get somebody to get something to get close to the president. It is outrageous. I hope that the next attorney general, the permanent attorney general, who I hope the president will nominate soon, will take control of this. And one of the first things he should do, the new attorney general, after sworn in, is have a meeting with Mr. Mueller, find out what's going on, where he is going and when he is going to end. That is a duty that the next attorney general has, because this investigation by Mueller is unconstitutional, it is founded on no crime, it is created by Rod Rosenstein because he is a gutless, duplicitous failure of a deputy attorney general. He should be ashamed of himself. And the new attorney general should fire Rosenstein ASAP.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, Herman, people ask, why do you bring up Clinton? Number one, these very same people that have attacked this president, you know, Peter Strzok, Page, Comey, they all set this up. And the reason is they allowed Hillary to get away with what were known crimes, and obstruction, and a violation of the Espionage Act. It's now incontrovertible. And that's the point. And then she paid for the phony Russian dossier that even Steele never stood by, went under oath and in derogatory in Great Britain. And yet, FISA court, FISA courts were lied to, information withheld, nothing was verified. And then, Russian lies fed to the American people paid for by her. How does that get ignored and we have no evidence here ever of any Trump/Russia collusion?

utterances.speaker: HERMAN CAIN, CHAIRMAN, AMERICA FIGHTING BACK
utterances.sentences: It gets ignored because of hypocrisy on steroids. Jerome Corsi is one of the most honest, honorable individuals on the planet. No one can remember ever word, every nuance of everything that they may have said over the last 10 years. No human being on earth. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } But when they get an opportunity to dig through dozens and dozens and thousands and thousands of pages of comments, they will pick out one thing that they want to use to run up the flag pole in order to try to make a case out of it. This is nothing but a witch hunt looking for a witch and they haven't found a witch in nearly two years, Sean. That's all it is.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I believe, Joe, if Jerome Corsi wanted to make it easy on himself, Paul Manafort wanted a lesser sentence. All they had to do was say what was wanted.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And by the way, we have Mueller and his Pitbull, Weissmann, have a history of this.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: Well, here is the deal. You are absolutely right. Both of these men could give Mueller the lies that he wants if they wanted to make life easy for themselves. But you bring up Weissmann. Let's remember, Andrew Weissmann has a reputation for being one of the most unethical prosecutors in the country. He has been rebuked many times. Here's the thing. Remember, Andrew Weissmann showed up at Hillary Clinton's victory party on election night. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: He sent Sally Yates an e-mail saying, bravo, for violating an order of the president of the United States when she refused to enforce the travel ban.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: It's a disgrace.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: That tells you why Mueller's team is compromised, conflicted, ethically in every conceivable way and it's a disgrace that Bob Mueller hired no Republicans and all Democrats who are Clintonistas.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Thank you both. Powerful testimony from both of you. We'll follow this closely. When we come back, my exclusive interview with homeland security secretary, Kirstjen Nielsen. What the destroy-Trump media doesn't want you to know about the border, next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. There is a Fox News alert as we continue to monitor the Senate election results out of Mississippi at this hour. Cindy Hyde- Smith leads 55.8 percent to 44.2 percent. Thirty-eight percent of the precincts are reporting. And we will continue to update you throughout the hour as these important results come in. Big difference here. It is either going to be 53-47 in the U.S. Senate, Republican advantage, or 52-48. A big difference for confirmations, big difference as it relates to Supreme Court justices that are trying to be confirmed. First, we go back to the crisis on our southern border. The H.S. Secretary, Kirstjen Nielsen, released a statement yesterday saying the migrant caravan is, quote, "far larger, more organized than previous once." Earlier, I sat down with the secretary to talk about this and so much more.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Joining us now is Secretary Nielsen. Madam Secretary, good to see you.

utterances.speaker: KIRSTJEN NIELSEN, SECRETARY OF HOMELAND SECURITY
utterances.sentences: Good to see you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let's talk first about the weekend. Let me quote one border patrol chief, Carla Provost. "Our agents were being assaulted. a group rushed the area throwing rocks and bottles at my men and women putting them in harm's way." And numerous other similar reports. How bad was it?

utterances.speaker: NIELSEN
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, Sean, first of all, let me just say, this is a testament to the training and professionalism of the border patrol that no one was hurt. We had 1,000 people rushing the border in a very violent and lawless way. We will not stand by as our border patrol are attacked. So, they defended themselves.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes. I don't know if they have any choice. The thing is, we see now that the mayor interestingly of Tijuana said, excuse me, Trump was right. This is an invasion. And they have now had a lot of issues that they have had to deal with. But the migrants, the caravan are still coming. And they are coming in bigger numbers. What if larger numbers of people rush the border, are you--

utterances.speaker: NIELSEN
utterances.sentences: We were--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: -- confident you are prepared?

utterances.speaker: NIELSEN
utterances.sentences: We were prepared this time. We will be prepared for any additional migrants. The president has made it quite clear. We will not tolerate illegal or violent entry into our country. So, this time, he talked about it for a month in advance as the caravans were making their way up. He raised awareness. He called in the military. He called in Concertina wire. We hardened the ports. We called in additional law enforcement, state and local and federal. And we are prepared. We will be prepared. We will not allow illegal entry into our country.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: One thing the president said, if they are going to be seeking asylum, they are not going to be in this country or allowed in this country while whatever process goes forward. One of the problems had been, people cross the border, they claim asylum, they get a court date, they are released into America and they never show up again. So, how insistent is the president that they stay in Mexico? And how are relations with Mexico considering they were told a long time ago they should be dealing with this?

utterances.speaker: NIELSEN
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know, this is an important point that you raised, Sean. Ultimately, we only see about 9 percent, 10 percent of Central Americans who make an asylum claim actually be granted asylum by an immigration judge. And that's really important. That's really important to put in perspective. So, 90 percent of those making asylum claims are not making the claim that can be honored under the statutory framework within the United States, it's not a valid reason for asylum. You have heard me say it before. If you are coming to get a job, that's not a claim for asylum. If you are coming to be with your family, that's not a claim for asylum.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Isn't it likely they are going to be coached? And if they really want asylum, didn't Mexico offer them work permits to work in South Mexico. That was apparently rejected by most. How many people are we now talking about in the remaining caravan still making its way north?

utterances.speaker: NIELSEN
utterances.sentences: So, we believe there will be about 10,000 ultimately. There is between 8,000 and 10,000 now. But you're exactly right. The government of Mexico offered everyone asylum. They also offered work permits. That's why this caravan is very different than ones we've seen in the past. Not only is it violent. But to the extent that it claims that its members would like to seek asylum. They have been offered asylum but they've turned it down in Mexico.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me play a shot from 60 Minutes, tis was Scott Pelley. The argument was about the separation issues and how there was a warrant for one 3-year-old. I do want to get your response to it. The president tweeted out, and we have images of even young people, when Obama was president, that are behind fences. They would say its cages if it was Donald Trump. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT PELLEY, CORRESPONDENT, CBS
utterances.sentences: The Trump administration made the decision to separate children from families. What responsibilities did they take on in your estimation?

utterances.speaker: CECILIA MUNOZ, FORMER OBAMA OFFICIAL
utterances.sentences: They issued an order without consulting with the agencies who were responsible for carrying out that order. We take better care of people's effects when we send them to the jail than we took care of the children who we took from their parents.

utterances.speaker: PELLEY
utterances.sentences: You quit your job at homeland security. I wonder why.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT SHUCHART, FORMER DHS OFFICIAL
utterances.sentences: I had taken an oath to uphold the Constitution. We were being asked as a department to do something that violated the civil rights and civil liberties of persons.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I want to get your reaction. Wasn't it President Trump that stopped the practice through an executive order?

utterances.speaker: NIELSEN
utterances.sentences: Sean, it was. But, you know, I am so disappointed in that piece. That is journalism. That's not journalism. That's factually incorrect. We did not have a policy to separate families from the children. What the president said and what all presidents have said before him, we enforce the law. This president takes that very seriously. So, what you saw was as we enforced the law against those who chose to enter illegally, mind you, not go legally to a port of entry but enter illegally. They were prosecuted. And because of that, if they had children with them, so as not to put children in a custodial jail, they were separated and put in the good care of HHS.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: NIELSEN
utterances.sentences: Yes, 60 Minutes, they need to go back and check their facts. They should have taken more time to understand how the immigration laws of this country work.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Results now coming in out of Mississippi. And the Republican has a big lead with a little over 40 percent of the vote in. We'll get to that. Also, the media going after our first lady over Christmas decorations. They can't stop hating a lovely first lady. They wouldn't do this to Michelle Obama, would they? We'll get to that. Jesse, Jessica, whose world? We'll find out next, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. This is a Fox News alert. We are monitoring the results out of the great state of Mississippi. And there you have it. At this moment, Cindy Hyde-Smith, she is leading 55 to 45 percent. Forty- six percent of precincts reporting. We'll have more on that. Our own Peter Doocy is on the ground in a minute. But first, Christmas season can't even slow down the media's unhinged, 24/7, every second, minute, hour of every day, Trump hate machine. Now they are using the White House Christmas display as a line of attack against the first lady. Look at this. They are calling the decoration "trees of death," comparing them to the Handmaid's tale. And you know what, it's really pretty despicable. I've seen it, absolutely beautiful, stunning decorations that go on. And you know what, all these media people, and we'll get to our guests. By the way, co-host of The Five, Watters World and Fox News contributor, Jessica Tarlov. How did you do it again?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Just in, and then out.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. In and out. WATTERS; There it is.

utterances.speaker: JESSICA TARLOV, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I'm going to set this out.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We're going to find whose world it is. We can't even let the first lady, and the great irony is, all of your liberal friends, they are begging for tickets. I know who they are, to get into the parties at the White House. You know where I'm not doing? I'm not going to a White House Christmas party.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I'm not either.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I wasn't invited, were you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I was. I can't believe that Trump didn't invite you, Sean, after all of the nice things you've said. Terrible. I'm so grateful.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You really want to run into all our fake news friends?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I just want to see the beautiful Christmas decorations. I think they are gorgeous.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It looks like they're shining.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Why do they constantly pick on the first lady? I do know. Who is beyond lovely, sacrifices a lot, is out there doing causes that, you know, are trying to help kids and people in the country. Why? I didn't see this. Michelle Obama got criticized for saying for the first time in my adult life I'm proud of my country.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Michelle Obama got criticized for a lot more, including wearing sleeveless shirts. There's an issue about her.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I never talk about it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm still upset about the shirt.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Her beautiful biceps. See, there you have it right there. Listen, the Christmas decorations, whether you like them or not, it's not really the point. I saw people really focusing on those be best decorations, you know, she's a -- cyberbullying campaign.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So what?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: With a husband who cyber bullies. It's hypocritical. She said that she was one of the most bullied people out there. I mean, if Michelle Obama--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Imagine, listen to this. Imagine if Hillary was elected--

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I'm so happy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- Bill Clinton would have been in charge of the Christmas decorations.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Imagine there have been mistletoe everywhere.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Jesse, that's below--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The media would love that too.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: That's beneath you. I will not do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know what, this is what happened when Trump won out.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That was funny. That was--

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I'm so glad you're back in studio for this.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: He is winning by a lot.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: He got you there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know what this is? This is when Trump derangement syndrome meets the war on Christmas. You get decoration gate. You guys are scared of Christmas decorations. I didn't think you were that big of a snowflake. I'm going to buy one of those Trumpy bears that we see on the Kim (Ph). I'm going to give one to you. It will be like your little emotional support animal.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Is hat real? Because I thought that was it. Is that Trumpy bear thing real?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I have no idea.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: You haven't seen this commercial?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's all too real.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It's frightening.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. It paces your salary.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It paces yours too, then.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank, God.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I don't make enough to the end of this conversation.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I have no idea.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I don't know. Listen, I don't think the trees are that big of a deal. I think--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Let me move on.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: OK, cool.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I just think we need to show the first lady, and Ivanka, leave the women and children out of it. Can we do that? Leave Baron--

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Ivanka works for the government.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: OK. Baron doesn't need to see another severed head of his -- of his. I'm sick of it.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I'm all for protecting Baron there, but, Ivanka--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I saw the Tom Arnolds--

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: -- works for them. Jared Kushner works for them. She is the first lady. She has taken on responsibility for this campaign.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Cindy Hyde-Smith looks like she is going to win tonight so far.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, the Deep South is still Trump country. The glue wave didn't go that far down. You know. Listen, it's important she gets this seat. Then you don't have to worry about, you know, the Romney swing vote, the Susan Collins swing vote. You have a very solid--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: They have a cushion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- Republican cushion in the Senate and it looks good.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: By the way, he didn't lose 69 seats like Obama in the House and Senate or 60 like Clinton.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: He netted seats. Clinton--

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: You are not actually going to argue that this was a job well done by the Republicans.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Compare 69-60.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And you add votes in--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And Trump wins seats because he went out and campaigned.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: We just picked up 40 states.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Check mate Trump.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: We just pick up 40 states.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I think 38 or 39.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: No. It hit 40 today because of the new California state.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I didn't hear that call.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes. Blue wave all over the place. The popular vote here.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: This is easy tonight. Sorry. In, out, his world. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do you guys agree?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: These people are against me, my own boyfriend.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes, they're all against you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Merry Christmas, Jessica. Merry Christmas.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We'll update you on Mississippi's vital Senate race. We'll have the latest results. Peter Doocy on the ground, next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Our own Peter Doocy standing by in Mississippi. I got 56 percent of the vote in and Hyde-Smith up by 11. It looks like it's going to be a Republican tonight in Mississippi.

utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCY, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: And, Sean -- and Sean, we just got an update from the Mike Espy headquarters about five minutes from here. They have turned off the projector screens that did show some of the returns coming in for the last few hours. So, right now a different mood over there compared to here where there does seem to be little bit of excitement building. No surprises with the Hyde- Smith team. The results that you're seeing right now is exactly the way that they say they projected it based on turnout and base on what they thought the mood was here in Mississippi despite all the controversy and all the national attention on the race the last couple of days. Sean?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Peter Doocy, great reporting. We'll get the final tally and call coming up probably pretty soon. All right. But unfortunately, this is terrible. It's all the time we have left. I can't stay here anymore. But let not your heart be troubled.  We're always fair and balanced. We're not the destroy-Trump media. Laura Ingraham is from Washington, D.C. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
